guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for paroxetine and CYP2D6

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily D member 6

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302559

text.html: NO action is needed for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The plasma concentration of paroxetine can increase as a result of the reduced activity of CYP2D6. However, studies did not find any clinical effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302581

text.html:
It is not possible to offer substantiated advice for dose adjustment based on the literature.

Avoid paroxetine. Antidepressants that are not metabolised by CYP2D6, or to a lesser extent, include for example citalopram or sertraline.

implications: Efficacy will probably be lacking. The genetic variation increases the conversion of paroxetine.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302603

text.html:
It is not possible to offer substantiated advice for dose adjustment based on the literature.

implications: Efficacy will probably be lacking. The genetic variation increases the conversion of paroxetine.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302563

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for paroxetine in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on paroxetine.
